title: U.K. Cuts Fuel Tax as Consumer Prices Rise at Fastest Rate in 30 Years
sub_head: Budget statement sees cut in growth forecasts on Russian invasion, some tax cuts to help squeezed households
body:
The U.K. government Wednesday announced a series of measures including a cut in fuel taxes to help households that are struggling to pay their bills, as soaring energy costs pushed inflation beyond an annual rate that was already the highest in 30 years.
As in the U.S., inflation has surged since early 2021, largely driven by rising energy prices, with food prices adding to the pressure. However, wage rises haven't kept pace, leaving British households facing a reduction in their real incomes.
